extendedIngredients.name: chocolate chips
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup semi sweet or dark chocolate chips

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey

recipes.title: Gluten Free Thin Mints
recipes.instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray or use a nonstick silicon liner.In a medium mixing bowl, mix together the dry ingredients, then add in the coconut oil, honey and peppermint. Stir until the mixture forms into a thick dough. Form the dough into balls about 3/4 inch in diameter and set them on the cookie sheet, flattening each one with the palm of your hand.Bake at 350 for about 8 minutes. Set the cookies in the freezer to cool.Now, put the chocolate, peppermint extract and coconut oil in a bowl and microwave on high for 60 seconds. Stir. If there are still lumps in the chocolate after a vigorous stir, microwave for 30 seconds longer and stir again. Repeat until the mixture is smooth.Pull the cookies out of the freezer and remove them from the cookie sheet. Line the cookie sheet with a nonstick liner (or waxed paper will do). Dip the cookies in the chocolate to cover completely and set them on the nonstick liner, leaving a little room between the cookies so they don't stick together.Let the chocolate set and then it's time to enjoy your thin mints!

steps.step: Preheat the oven to 350 F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray or use a nonstick silicon liner.In a medium mixing bowl, mix together the dry ingredients, then add in the coconut oil, honey and peppermint. Stir until the mixture forms into a thick dough. Form the dough into balls about 3/4 inch in diameter and set them on the cookie sheet, flattening each one with the palm of your hand.

Bake at 350 for about 8 minutes. Set the cookies in the freezer to cool.Now, put the chocolate, peppermint extract and coconut oil in a bowl and microwave on high for 60 seconds. Stir. If there are still lumps in the chocolate after a vigorous stir, microwave for 30 seconds longer and stir again. Repeat until the mixture is smooth.Pull the cookies out of the freezer and remove them from the cookie sheet. Line the cookie sheet with a nonstick liner (or waxed paper will do). Dip the cookies in the chocolate to cover completely and set them on the nonstick liner, leaving a little room between the cookies so they don't stick together.
Let the chocolate set and then it's time to enjoy your thin mints!
